fields.description:
As a Lean Project Coordinator 
I would like a horizontal scrollbar on JIRA Agile Kanban Board
So that the number of columns (value stream stages) can grow to any number

I believe the original request for the Scrum rapid board was fair as much as this one.

Ideally JIRA Agile should support a configuration that allows fixed board or scrollable board.

In the meanwhile we can use one of the hacks I described in http://thinkinginsoftware.blogspot.com/2013/11/jira-agile-extended-kanban-board.html which involves modifying the style after the page is rendered via a script that can be run from a browser plugin like https://github.com/nestoru/tampermonkey-jira-extended-rapidboard
fields.summary: As a Lean Project Coordinator I would like a horizontal scrollbar on JIRA Agile Kanban Board

fields.description:
I had a user story that I removed from a sprint, but now I can not see it in Plan Mode to add it to another sprint.  This user story has a new workflow associated to it and is in Needs Acceptance, but is NOT Resolved or Closed.  This is the second time this has happened.  You can get to the user story by searching for it, but can not see it in Plan Mode or on the Agile Board.

Any Suggestions on how to fix this?
fields.summary: User story removed from a sprint and now unable to see in Plan Mode

fields.description:
I just created a Epic and used the "create issue in epic" command to create some stories.
The stories were created successfully and I cant see them in the task list and in the issues/recent issues.
But I can't see anything on the board where the epic is. the epic counters are all zero.
fields.summary: Can't see issues created inside Epic form
Translation of "Commitment" in Jira Agile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10108].
  {panel}

Unfortunatly the great renaming of usernames in newer JIRA instances will lead to corrupt quick filters in Jira Agile, because it seems to you have forgotten renaming users in Quick Filters when system user is renamed!

Tested with
* Jira 6.1
* Jira Agile 6.3.2.2
fields.summary: If a user is renamed, fix the Quick Filters and Swimlanes which refer to that user name

fields.description:
When creating an issue, the prefilled project is the one most recently 'loaded' as opposed to being set from the board currently being viewed.

For example, if view an Agile board driven by Project A and then click Create Issue, it will populate the Project field with Project A.

However, if I:
1. View the board for Project A
2. Open the board for Project B in a new tab
3. Switch back to the tab with the Project A board and create a new issue

I observe that the prepopulated value is Project B, even though I am viewing the board for Project A. Note that regular JIRA exhibits the same behaviour if we substitute Agile Boards for the project view.

This is just a minor QoL change, but it's all these little things that combine to make a great, seamless UX so I figured it would be worth raising. Thanks!
fields.summary: As a user viewing a rapid board, I would like any issues I create to default to the project driving the board

fields.description:
I am discriminating between two of my product backlogs by use of a custom field, which identifies the hardware type that the issue applies to.

However, though I can populate the custom field when I raise the issue as an epic, via the normal 'Create issue' dialog, it is not possible when I press create Epic.
Because my AgileBoard is based upon a filter which finds issues with a particular value in this custom field, and I have not had an opportunity to set the field, the newly created epic does not appear in the board.

Therefore can custom fields be added to the creation of the epic?
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to configure which custom fields can appear when using the 'Create Epic' screen

fields.description:
Being able to base Swimlanes on Stories or Assignee is simply not enough. JQL is great but what I keep hearing from managers in our company that want to use Kanban is that they want to be able to do a "group by" similar to a group by clause in SQL.

Our biggest win would be to add Component to the "Base Swimlanes on" dropdown. Even better would be to add "Attribute" to the dropdown with a text box allowing someone to enter the attribute to group on; from there they could pick "Epic Name", Assignee, Component, etc...
fields.summary: As a manager with a Kanban Board, I want to be able to dynamically group my board by an attribute so that I may more easily organize my team's work

fields.description: Currently you can only start the sprint that is at the head of the Plan section of the board.  Although the ability to move sprints around (which has been requested in GHS-6131) would somewhat ease this restriction it would also be very useful if ALL sprints on the plan had a 'start' button.  That way if you decide you want to start a sprint that happens to be lower down the board you can do it in only one click, with no need to do any re-arranging.
fields.summary: As a user I would like a 'start sprint' button on all Sprints on 'Plan' Board

fields.description: Currently you need to find the sprint ID and then use that. This is leading to problems if we insert sprints for interim releases as devs are using their 'known' sprint IDs which no longer are applicable. Can you please change the sprint field to make it so that if you type the version number it looks up the relevant versions and you can select from there  (as you already do in the filters?
fields.summary: Lookup required for Sprint field

fields.description: I want to identify the story point field, which is of type number. For instance the id can be customfield_1008 or customfield_1009... and the name varies on language. For instance Story Points (=EN) Story Punkte (=DE)
fields.summary: Unique Identifier allowing identification of (greenhopper) custom fields

fields.description: I have the tool JIRA that currently there are 300 people using, but only one team would use the functions of the Green Hopper. There are how to buy a license only for the team that will use and not for the rest of the company?
fields.summary: Is to implement the Green Hopper to only a certain group in JIRA?

fields.description: I am elevating the issue in [this post on Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/220415/prevent-adding-a-story-to-a-sprint-if-it-has-no-story-point-estimate] to the bug state.  Adding stories that have not been estimated to a sprint should not be allowed.
fields.summary: Prevent adding a story to a sprint if it is unestimated

fields.description:
Hi, 

I'm unable to close the sprint and move tasks not completed into the backlog of work? This issue has been raised in the forums and is present an issue with using the system effectively. 

I'm using the ondemand instance. 

Please can you close the sprint or provide details of how this can be achieved with the error appearing. The behaviour we are now seeing is not how it behaved on previous sprints. 

http://cl.ly/image/0z1n46462i37

Ta

P
fields.summary: Unable to close sprint

fields.description: The [Managing Agile Projects page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+agile+projects] is based largely on the Classic Boards, and seems out place hierarchically in the space (it's placed under working with JIRA). At the very least, it should be updated for the new boards, point to updated documentation for the new boards, or state clearly that it applies to the Classic Boards.
fields.summary: Consider updating or removing 'Managing Agile Projects'

fields.description:
For stories, a user will be prompt when completing all the sub-tasks for the particular story whether he/she would like to closed the Story as well.

For epics, there isn't such feature. It would be nice if we could get a prompt message to move Epic to done when all the stories of the particular epic has been closed.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically transition Epic to Done
creating an issue

fields.description:
If you access the document below, you will see that the content of this doc has a broken layout in many different pages (starting at page 6):

- [AGILE 6.3.2|http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/greenhopper/downloads/documentation/AGILE-6-3-20130905-PDF.pdf]

Please take a moment to access this doc and correct the formatting of the broken pages, otherwise it is almost impossible to understand the content of some parts of this document.
fields.summary: As an user, I want the Agile documentation from downloads.atlassian.com to be formatted

fields.description:
Quick Filters are always added from the far left of the screen, and then to be entered from left to right, until the row fills up, then begin another one, etc.

Some Interface changes would be very welcome to make this more manageable, practical, and visually appealing.  Being able to center them, make multiple rows of quick filters according to categories or as needed would go a long way towards improving usability.
fields.summary: Allow relocating and reorganization of quick filters

fields.description:
the ''Blocker'' indication on the Sprint Health gadget generically selects all issues that have the highest priority.

Different prioritization and sprint management needs generate a need to different definitions as to what is a ''Blocker''.

It would be needed to be able to customize the results in the agile health gadget to display the stats from custom filters rather then a fixed definition.

Thank you,
fields.summary: Allow customization of Agile Sprint Health Gadget filters

fields.description:
When selecting a quick filter, the selected filters are saved according to the mode they were selected in:

Ex: I select Quick filter ''A'' in Plan mode.
-I go to work mode, I have to reselect quick filter''A''
-I add quick filter ''B'' in Work mode, I return to plan mode
-Plan mode will still only have ''A'' Selected.

It would be great if the selected quick filter would carry over.

Thank you,
fields.summary: As a user, i'd like to have my selected quick filters maintain themselves across both plan and work mode.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Apply* button of _Refine Report_ of the Cumulative Flow Diagram is not visible when there is many Columns/Swimlanes/Quick Filters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Board
# Configure many Columns/Swimlanes/Quick Filters
# Access the Cumulative Flow Diagram and try to refine the report

h3. Expected Results
# Users are able to refine and click on the *Apply* button as normal

h3. Actual Results
The *Apply* button is hidden because it is at the bottom of the screen
!2013-11-14 19 58 38.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
Happens in all browsers

h3.Workaround
Some might find it possible to scroll down by clicking and dragging downwards as if they want to highlight texts. However, this does not work in some cases and for these users, there are no workarounds.
fields.summary: Huge amount of quick filters makes apply button disappear in report view

fields.description:
It says the Browser version is not supported, but IE 11 is essentially IE 10 with touch enhancements.
So Jira Agile should probably not give up and quit unless you know actually KNOW that IE 11 doesn't work, of course.
fields.summary: Agile Menu option in Jira fails when using IE 11 (Internet Explorer preview version)
Deleting a column in the config does not show any mapped statuses in the unmapped column until the page is refreshed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10075].
  {panel}

An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'statusCategory' of undefined
Resource: http://jira.mach.com/s/en_LUrf6duy-418945332/854/10/957882cdca60d139640aa012625bade7/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
Line: 721
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/30.0.1599.101 Safari/537.36
fields.summary: Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'statusCategory' of undefined

fields.description: We have the option to import one or more projects from one instance to another, but there is no option to import one or more boards to another instance. Customer would like the ability to do it.
fields.summary: Importing boards from one instance to other.

fields.description:
When displaying a sub-task on a Kanban board, we can see above the sticker the name of the main task.
It would be very nice to have a direct link to this main task to reach this one.
This would avoid clicking on the sub-task, then opening the sub-task and finally accessing the main task.

See the attached pdf file..
fields.summary: Link main task in subTask displayed on an Agile board

fields.description:
I've really been digging the flexibility of the new Agile board, but have hit one blocker that I can't get around. 
*Short explanation:* I'd like to be able to display cards on the board in RANK order, but disable the ability to move the RANK of the cards on the same board.
*Long explanation:* I am experimenting with managing the requirements definiton and project portfolio prioritization with several boards based on the same project, each giving a different view of the issues in the project. The Project is really my project portfolio, and each task represents a potential project that could impact one or more of our systems. I have one board that I want to use with the stakeholders to establish the overall priority of the initiatives. The card format is very useful for visualizing everything in the portfolio and allowing us to reorder priorties on the fly. (I have two basic columns for this -- "Unprioritized" and "Prioritized.")
I have another board I want to use to track the progress of the requirements definition. I have two statuses defined in my custom workflow - "Prioritized" and "Defining." What I'd love to be able to do is display all the initiatives in priority (RANK) order and drag the cards between "Prioritized" and "Defining," but not allow the rank assigned to the card on the planning board (whose column "Prioritized" contains both statuses, "Prioritized" and "Defining") to be modified on this screen. When I remove the "Order by" clause in the filter it disables the RANK feature, but it also displays the cards in random order, making it difficult for the team to quickly see what should be their next priority for their requirements process.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I'd like to disable ranking (moving of cards) on a board, but display the cards in RANK order so that I may manage project prioritization on one board and requirements definition on another

fields.description: I would like the JQL “was” operator to support “sprint name”. For example, this is a query I would like to run: category='GID - Portfolio projects' and 'Work Group' = Application and Type = Story and Sprint was '232' on '2013/10/05 20:00'.
fields.summary: JQL should support "was" with "sprint name"

fields.description:
The quick filters are a great addition to the planning and task boards.  Can this be added to the chart board as well? I know its not scrumesk to view an individual performance, but it would certainly be nice to at least be able to view my own chart board or the chart board of a specific component so I can keep track of my progress.

I know this can be accomplished with a filter, but that effects the entire board which is not what I'm after
fields.summary: Quick Filters on Rapid Chart Board

fields.description: We use Kanban rapid boards to track our issues and noticed that if the summary string doesn't have a space it won't wrap on the cards, making them hard to distinguish at a glance. If it does have a space, it wraps nicely onto 3 lines. See attached screen shot for examples of both.
fields.summary: long summary strings don't wrap on cards without a space

fields.description:
It would be great if we can have an option to see all the Epic information in the Issue View screen, when viewing the Epic issue.

Here is the information we have in the Epic Panel:

!epic.png|thumbnail!

When opening the "Scrum-3" issue, we can't find this information (# of issues Completed, Unestimated, Estimate) in the issue details.
fields.summary: Epic information in the Issue View screen

fields.description:
Having several teams working on several projects which will all be part of a new software release, I would like to be able to define a version once and use it in all the projects making up my new software release.
Curently I have to define the very same version in all the projects going into the release. Boards sharing these projects show this version once for each of them, which is very confusing.
fields.summary: Share the Version among several projects

fields.description:
I think that this is what the Agile Reports in the "Projects/Agile" menu are intended to do now, but these are not working, and anyway, they are using the Classic Boards. 

I would love to have the option to show burndown charts based on Story Points and on Hours (aggregating the hours of the sub-tasks). 

It would be really nice! :)
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I'd like to see the Burndown Chart of each of the versions in my Road Map, so I can monitor how we are progressing

fields.description: Try this link https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!Init.jspa?pid=10420&issuetype=2&summary=the%20highlighted%20text%2C%20the%20window%20will%20scroll%20to%20accommodate%20the%20dialog it will return the error message just like the attached image
fields.summary: If using the submit form to create issue of JIRA. the error will appear at the bottom

fields.description:
Recently, a team member (out of frustration) adjusted the Original and Remaining time estimates on an issue to 52w. No one realized it until we all saw the burndown chart start to look very strange (the guideline was basically flat and the red line for remaining values had a nice spike in it). We all laughed...until I realized I couldn't undo it.

In order for the sprint not to be permanently modified on accident (or playfully), it would be beneficial to be able to delete an RTE change record.

The only work-around I see is to prematurely close the sprint and start a new one, which is not acceptable either.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to delete Remaining Time Estimate change records

fields.description:
Include observation below in the document: [Releasing a Version (Kanban)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=391087245]

(i) Please note that the issues will only disappear from the 'Done' column once all their versions are released. The release of existing versions must be done via the Project Administration > Versions screen.
fields.summary: Improve our page about 'Releasing a Version (Kanban)'

fields.description: As a PM I would like to be able to also (in addition to Version and Epic) to be able to filter backlog (planning view) by issue components.
fields.summary: As PM I would like to filter Planning view by Components

fields.description:
As a project manager with boards that have hundreds of issues on them 
and a team that can be anywhere from 10-20+ people 
I want a freeform quick filter that I can just type in a query directly on the board and it will filter the board appropriately
So I can quickly find issues on the board that I didn't create static "Quick Filters" for - especially when I just want to filter by one person's name. (I really don't want to create a quick filter for each member of the team!)
fields.summary: Freeform Quick Filter on Agile Boards

fields.description:
I'm a big fan of your keyboard shortcuts, they make live easier and working with the board faster. (y)

So:
Suppose that I have two Quick Filters: "A" and "B".
"A" is turned ON and "B" is turned OFF.

I now want to switch to "B".

Instead of turning "A" OFF *and* turning "B" ON by myself.... :(

... I just can (_for example_) {{Shift}}-click "B" (pressing {{Shift}} while clicking) and as a result "A" is automatically turned OFF (of course by that I mean automatically turning all Quick Filters OFF that were turned ON before my interaction).
:) :) :) :) :) :) :) :)
fields.summary: [Keyboard Shortcut] Sexy "One-Click Switch Mode" between Quick Filters

fields.description:
In JIRA, the sub-task that is created after the story has fixVersion will get all the sub-tasks to be part of the same fixVersion. In GreenHopper Classic Board, adding the story to a version will get all its sub-tasks to be updated to the same version as well. This does not apply on the latest JIRA Agile.

It would be good to have the sub-tasks to automatically be added or prompt the user whether to add to the particular version, when the story (its parent) is added to the version. This is known to be a useful feature in Classic board, and lacking of this feature could affect the metrics such in the following scenario (given by customer)

{quote}
- I did not manage to complete the story before end of the version, so I have to move it. The Story will be listed under the new version but the actual work is still in the old version.
- In the version workload report, I cannot see the sub-task efforts in the correct version, so I am mis-lead and will think, I can still add more to the new version, but the workload should already be 100% if the tasks had followed the story.
- In the agile rapid board, the versions list the remaining efforts, but the remaining effort is incorrect because the sub-tasks are in the wrong version.
- In the progress reports (agile and non-agile), the wrongly versioned sub-tasks will show up as an added effort, added too late in the process.{quote}
fields.summary: Adding a story to Version should automatically update its sub-tasks

fields.description: Get black T-shirt design (2 color) ready to go to printer with all appropriate files.
fields.summary: Black T-shirt design

fields.description:
As well as [Agile Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget] and [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget] already have, at least for us it's very important that [Agile Wallboard Gadget] also exposes the Sprint filter.

We used to work with several Sprints simultaneously, because we are working on a Program and, due that, we've divided our teams to address more than one sprint at the same period.

For control, we have a specific dashboard (with lots of information gadgets) for each sprint that we created. So, without this kind of feature, all the activities (from all sprints) will be demonstrated at once.

It's not good for us. So please, consider to implement this feature.
fields.summary: As a PMO responsible for monitoring projects, I think it's very necessary that [Agile Wallboard Gadget] be able to expose (even optionally) a new filter called Sprint (as a Combo box)

fields.description:
Classic boards, in terms of information, were better than the new burndown chart.

We've lost some important information. On Classic Boards we had 5 (colored lines), besides forecasts, with lots of information such as:
1) Remaining Values
2) Remaining Values - Ongoing (dotted line)
3) Remaining Values - Trend (dashed line)
4) Guideline (solid line)
5) Team effort - Completed (solid line)
6) Team effort - Ongoing (dotted line)
7) Estimate accuracy (solid line)
8) Estimate accuracy - Ongoing (dotted line)

The next ones were extremely important for us:
9) Required daily burndown rate (solid line)
10) Required daily burndown rate - Ongoing (dotted line)

Please Atlassian, consider to putting the above information back on the new Burndown Chart.
fields.summary: As a PMO responsible for monitoring projects, mainly burndown charts, it would be great if the information presented on classic burndown could be also presented on the new burndown chart (i.e. [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget]).

fields.description:
Currently, ONLY active sprints are demonstrated on GADGETs (i.e.: [Agile Days Remaining in Sprint] AND [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget]).

After closing the sprint, these gadgets simply expose the following message: "There are no active sprints". And, due that, the only place available to consulting the information is the RapidBoard.

However, in our case, all control regarding to the sprint is in a single painel (JIRA dashboard). Due that, it would be great keep seeing the sprint on those gadgets, even after the sprint is closed.
fields.summary: As a PMO responsible for monitoring dashboards it would be great if sprints could be ALWAYS consulted on monitoring dashboards (through GADGETs, no matter they were finalized or not)

fields.description: We have several parallel scrum teams, each having their own board with their own filters. We also have some projects in Jira that are common libraries that are shared between the teams. As a result, the "sprint X" on "board A" will also become visible on "board B". If the sprints become board-aware, the interface can get an option to only show the sprints that belong to the current Agile Board.
fields.summary: Sprints should be board-aware

fields.description: The project owner would be able to configure the Story Points field such that a specified list of numbers, and only those numbers would be available when selecting Story Points.  As an example of how this might be used, as  project owner, I would configure the Story Points field such that only the following numbers 1,2,3,5,8,13,21,36 (the Fibonacci numbers) are selectable options for Story Points.  Each Agile project could configure their own set of available Story Point values.  By default, all numbers would be accepted.
fields.summary: Allow a controlled vocabulary for possible values in Story Points.

fields.description:
As in the JIRA Agile [6.2.1 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/GreenHopper+6.2.1+Release+Notes] and [6.3 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.3+Release+Notes], stated that
bq. Some convenient new features include independent scrolling for each panel in Plan mode and Work mode.
This give some confusion of the independent scrolling, is it for each panel of both boards as in Plan Board (versions,backlog,details) and Work Board (statuses) or actually scrolling of the whole board each, and there is no indication whether this is for Scrum or Kanban.

In JIRA Agile 6.2.1 onwards for Scrum:
User could scroll on each panel independently on Plan Board, but unable to do the same for the statuses in the Work Board.

for Kanban:
User could scroll independently on the detail view but not for statuses for the work board.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Documentation Independent Scrolling is Incorrect

fields.description: See attached screenshot. Appears on JIRA Bulk Edit -> Edit issue.
fields.summary: Change sprint field in JIRA Bulk Edit refers to GreenHopper instead of JIRA Agile

fields.description:
In previous versions of JIRA Agile, Epics were associated to Stories via Issue links.
This allowed users to link a Story to multiple Epics.

On newer versions, Epics are now associated using a custom field which enables only a single ticket to be selected.

It would be great if we could have the ability to add more than one Epic to the Story back again.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to be able to link more than one Epic to the same Story

fields.description:
We have a specific section in our dashboards to demonstrate issues that were removed from the sprint. To do that, we use pre-saved filters with the WAS operator inside the JQL clause.

When an initiative is for just one project and is related to one or more versions to the project, there are no problems. Because, in this particular case, we use the version as the base for JQL and WAS operator is allowed.

But, on the other hand, when the initiative involves more than one project and we we need to use Scrum Rapid Boards with special field SPRINT. This field just doesn't allow history searches.
fields.summary: As a user, it would be great if I can query the sprint history using the WAS operator (by JQL)

fields.description:
{{assignee = currentUser()}}

or

{{assignee = currentUser() or (reviewer = currentUser() AND status in "Review")}}

are handy filters for keeping one Team-board but everyone is able to easily restrict his view BUT..

Restricting of Swimlanes are do not know anything about these filters, so still view is filtered to currentUser with one issue in progess and restriction of max "1" in progress still leads to a red lane ... for everyone ;( That's not so handy ...

related to but not the same as like
GHS-3681
fields.summary: As a Rapid board user, I would like to see MY restrictions only

fields.description: At the moment the Agile menu contains a list of last visited agile boards. I'd like to see an option to choose some favorites that would always show up in the menu and then you could have a list of the last visited boards.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to store my favorite 1-5 agile boards under the Agile menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprints from "Sprint 2" are appearing in the Sprint Report for "Sprint 1".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add issues to Sprint 1.
# Import that project into another instance.
# Add the issues back into the sprint as the AO data is not migrated due to JRA-28748.

h3. Expected Results

The issues don't appear in the incorrect sprint report(s).

h3. Actual Results

Issues appear in the Sprint Report that belong to another sprint.

h3. Notes

This particular bug only applies for issues with the change history as per the attached image.
fields.summary: Issues are appearing in a Sprint Report from another Sprint

fields.description:
As project manager (waterfall and agile) who is using heavily CFD for :
- monitor output
- forecast % delivery

please, will need be added visual forecast , as same as in most of burndown chart

see below mockup proposal.
!CFD forecast.png!
1. in Chart Board, add an option "Forecast base"
2. For each status, allow to choose between : 
- last 24h, 
- last 48h, 
- last 72h, 
- last 5 days, 
- since Sprint Start
(bonus : from a specific date)
Common requirement : all of them excluding week-end, and non-working days


3. At end of line, display % forecast based on current total

Benefits : 
- For reporting and live review with stakeholder, 
be able to visualize and tell 
"all right, with current velocity of current team, and assuming we freeze right now request for current period, we will likely 
- deliver X %
- Y % will be done but to review and closed only next Sprint
- Z % will be pushed for next sprint

To minimize Y % , team will need more ... 
To minimize Z %, we need more support from ..."
Thanks!
fields.summary: CFD Cumulative Flow Diagram - add visual forecast with variable based

fields.description:
I would like to be able to move issues in and out of sprints without the annoying warnings about scope change.  I use sprints to organise work into categories (e.g. This week/Soon/Ideas/Next Version/etc).  As such, I am constantly moving issues between sprints, and the warning about scope change is irrelevant and annoying.  It should be a very simple change to allow a configuration item for this option.

Currently, I do not actually start my sprints, so that I can work without this warning, but Agile does not let me use the "Work" screen without starting my sprints.  It would be nice to have access to the "work" pages, while still retaining the simple drag-drop for shifting issues between the various categories.
fields.summary: Allow issues to be added to active sprints without showing warning of scope change

fields.description: Is it possible to customize the Plan Board display, the Back Log list?  I want to add assignee beside the Epic, Version.
fields.summary: Customize the Agile Plan Board display

fields.description:
On the sprint report chart add the ability to hide the non-working days (which appear shaded at the moment).

This is similar functionality to what already exists for the burndown report.
fields.summary: Add ability to hide non working days on sprint report

fields.description:
As a user of JIRA Agile I want to see a label heat map when I choose so in a report view (like Burndown Chart, Epic Report, etc) for a selected sprint or backlog in order to get an overview of the theme or focus of that part of my agile process.

Please also support functionality described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35552
fields.summary: Offer heatmap of labels in report view

fields.description:
When I click on an issue in the rapid board, the Issue Detail View is opened in which you can only edit a view of the fields, but not for instance the component(s) field. 

We have a lot of new issues coming in that need to be triaged and given a component and to do this we need to open the edit popup to change the fields. It would be way more faster just to be able to edit everything in the Issue Detail view
fields.summary: Enhance inline editing of Issue Detail View on rapid board

fields.description: Please add the "Create Board" functionality to the "Agile" menu as it makes it easier to create boards.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like the ability to create boards from the Agile menu

fields.description:
- configure: when configuring a project, admin selects the story point scale set (see attached menu)
- usage: when pointing a story, the field value comes from a drop down menu, and can only be a part of that set

See screenshot for example on usage.
fields.summary: As a admin, I'd like to configure Story Point scales per project or board

fields.description:
Currently, when you close an Epic/mark it as 'Done', it will still be displayed in the *Epic Link* field suggestions.

It would be useful to be able to limit the list in the *Epic Link* field based on the *Epic Status* value of the existing Epics.
fields.summary: Closed/Completed Epics Not to Be Displayed in the Epic Link Field Suggestions

fields.description:
Hi there

I use the following work sub-filter for a Kanban board:

(fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() or fixVersion is EMPTY) and fixVersion not in ("Won't Fix", "To be assessed", "Wishlist") and issuetype != Epic

Tasks with EMPTY value for fixVersion do not show up on my board. 
We have to tag their fixVersion with an unreleasedVersion in order for them to show up

Are we doing something wrong? Please advise!

Thanks

Lisa
fields.summary: Work sub-filter on Agile Kanban board not working

fields.description:
How to duplicate:

- Select AGILE, then select CLASSIC
- Navigate to TOOLS (top right)
- Select BULK EDIT
- Witness stack trace

This was tested in three OnDemand instances and crashed in all three.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit in 'Classic' Planning Board causes Error 500 Stack Trace

fields.description:
On the epic report, the total original estimate only takes into account the stories/tasks that are linked to the epic but it does not take into account the estimates associated with the sub-tasks of those stories.

We use original time estimate as our estimation metric and it becomes very difficult to plan our sprints without this information.

We may have a story with 100 sub-tasks and all estimated however the original estimate will show up as 0 which i think is a bug.

Rahul
fields.summary: Epic report - total estimate is incorrect

fields.description: As a user I want a way to type in the velocity of a sprint (reflecting  the estimation model: Time, Story points...) in order to see what is the top threshold when managing many different scum teams
fields.summary: Capability to define a sprint velocity as an element

fields.description:
As a board manager I can define multiple sprints.
This is very helpful to "tentative" scope in some cases.

The request is:
As a board manager I want to specify dates for future sprints without using the sprint name space. I want a proper date selector.
fields.summary: Sprint tentative Strong date

fields.description:
This problem could either be epics that were created before the upgrade to GH 6.0.6, or epics created without specifying a value for this field. 

As a user, we faced a lot of work to do manually edit Epics in UI. We understand there is a workaround from this [article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Unlabelled+Epics], hence it could be better if GH can change the most meaningful value is the *Summary* for the Epics we have created before upgrade.

h4.Workaround:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Unlabelled+Epics
fields.summary: Trim unlabelled Epic Names to Summary when upgrade prior GH 6.0.5 to latest version

fields.description:
As Agile Boards are very easy to create, and as users are able to create so many of them so easily, our JIRA eventually has a large number of boards, many of which are no longer used or needed. 

As each board adds performance overhead to a number of operations, it would be prudent to trim down the boards that are no longer in use or no longer point to an active owner.

We'd like to have an interface where boards can be selected by bulk criteria and bulk-deleted as needed. Sample criteria would be last accessed prior to (time), owner not active in JIRA, underlying filter has been removed, and others.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile Administrator, I'd like to be able to identify and bulk-delete out of use Agile Boards.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9983].
  {panel}

Reproduction:

1. Create a new sprint
2. Create an issue and drag it into the new sprint
3. Close the issue. The issue will now not be visible in the sprint on the planning board anymore.
4. Delete the sprint using the "x" button.
Result: Error: This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status.
Expected: When closing the issue, it is removed from the planned (unstarted) sprint, so the sprint can be deleted without errors.
fields.summary: Closing an issue in a planned (unstarted) sprint does not remove it from the sprint, causing errors when deleting the sprint

fields.description: so that I don't have to open multiple tab or waste time opening pop-up I don't want to see
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to edit with the pencil icon any field of the issue details view

fields.description:
It would be cool if there is a way to hide the release Link on a Task-Board.
So if multiple projects with different Release-Cycles are assigned to a board no one accidently adds a Version to all of these Products.
Or maybe hide the link automaticly if multiple products are assigned.

Alternatively, or even better would be, if the user is getting asked for which projects the release is.
Display a list of assigned projects and, check one ore multiple projects to confirm release.
fields.summary: No "Release..." Link on Agile Boards if multiple Projects are assigned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9979].
  {panel}

*Original request description:*

*Acceptance Criteria*
* Paginate after 100 boards
* Provide a search box to filter boards by name
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster I would like pagination on the Manage Boards page so I can reach my desired board faster

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9977].
  {panel}

I was not sure of where the action will take me - so I pressed the command key so a new browser tab is open. A dialog which layout is broken appeared.

* Steps:

- Go to the View Issue Page.
- Click on the  _View on Board_ Link on the _Agile_ Panel whilst pressing down the _CMD_ key.
- *Bug*, a broken view issue page will be displayed in a dialog. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Clicking on 'View on Board' link with command key pressed opens a broken dialog
Bulk edit screen has reference to GreenHopper

fields.description:
Please see attached and tell me why I can't upload

Thanks,
fields.summary: Need Help with Webdav access to on demand instance

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Board A and Associate to Project A
# Create an issue A in Project A
# Create a Sprint A in Board A
# Associate Issue A to Sprint A (don't start the sprint)
# Create a Board B and Associate to Project B
# Move Issue A from Project A to Project B
# Check that Board B will have Issue A with Sprint A associated.
# Delete Sprint A from Board A
# The Issue A associated to Project B in Board B will be placed in the backlog.

Expected behaviour:

Don't delete the sprint in the new board even when deleting the previous sprint in another board.
fields.summary: Moving an issue from one Board that belongs to a Sprint and deleting the previous Sprint that hasn't been started will delete the sprint created in the new Board as well.

fields.description:
We´re already using the Sprint Burndown Gadget to show an overview about how´s the sprint going on, but this one is missing some very important features like the "Estimation Accuraccy"!
The "old" one (Agile Gadget) was very very useful, but it always adds  "AND NOT fixVersion is EMPTY" although we do not want this as planning is done differently at us.
At the moment there is no option to get the "Estimation Accuracy" chart in any other gadget but we´re really missing that feature!
Please just delete the additional filter query and then everything is fine!

Also discussed [here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9388]
fields.summary: Re-provide graphical effort accuracy diagram

fields.description:
When viewing an issue's history in the All tab, it displays the name and the ID of the sprint, when the issue was added to it.

However, if you edit the sprint name, this is not reflected in the issue's history, and it can lead to confusion.


Suggestion: just add to the issue's history the ID of the sprint, and retrieve the name of it on the fly, so the sprint can be renamed several times and the issue history will reflect that.
fields.summary: When a sprint is renamed, it would be useful to have the latest name of the sprint in the issue history

fields.description:
Configuration for the Flagged field doesn't seem to be provided for Rapid Boards (Scrum/Kanban). Being able to configure the Flagged Field in the deprecated Classic Boards, posed a couple of advantages:
# Users could configure different types of Flags (as suited for their usecases)
# From the board configuration, it is easy to determine in which field the flag for issues are stored in JIRA.
# Although the flagged field is not Locked by default, if it was deleted, admins could easily create and configure a new one etc. 

Unfortunately, because this field is still unlocked by default, Rapid board users:
# Would often delete it and then wonder where all their Rapid Board Flags are being stored.
# Also, users who had been using their own/custom Flagged fields in Classic boards,  before migrating to Rapid boards are prone to be even more confused about this because there is no longer an easy way to determine where this Issue flag data is stored like there was in the Classic Board Configuration Screen and Project Template configuration for classic boards.

This 'Flagging issues' feature should be configurable to some extent atleast in Rapid Boards as well
fields.summary: Configuration of Flagged Field in Rapid Boards

fields.description:
We have several sprints defined. We have added spring field to Create Issue form. But this is just a simple text field (I would expect drop- down list) and it is not possible to assign newly created issue to sprint when creating.

We have to add issue and then manually drag and drop it to requested sprint.

Is it possible to have this sprint drop down on create issue screen in order to assign issue to one of defined sprints?

Thank ypi for your support
fields.summary: Sprint field in Create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9965].
  {panel}

If you try to create a sample project in JIRA Agile through (_Agile > Getting Started > create a sample project_) for Scrum or Kanban, the following error is displayed:

{noformat}
An error occurredHide…

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details

        Exception: TypeError: t is undefined
        Resource: https://clarissa.atlassian.net/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_US5id6mh-1988229788/6144/8/aebbf4f94c0d9f010871beaf3c294cec/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,jira.global/batch.js
        Line: 2726

Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.8; rv:24.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/24.0
{noformat}

The board is created, but the error message is thrown.

!demo project.png!

This only happens on OnDemand, could not replicate it using JIRA Standalone.
fields.summary: Create a sample project on JIRA Agile in Atlassian OnDemand throws error

fields.description:
"@ mention" functionality does not work -- the system is not auto-completing the user's name when typed.

Steps to replicate:
# Logged into my project and on the Agile Scrum Board at link https://projects.premierinc.com/issues/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&view=planning&selectedIssue=FV-1....
# Click into an Issue Type = Story,  I have clicked on story in Sprint 1 called FV-1 and the entire story is displayed on a single screen
# Scroll down the issue page to the Activity section and click "Comment"
# Create an "@ mention" for user named Jen O'Brien.  **Bug**  You will notice that you cannot create an "@ mention" for this user or any other user who is setup with an active login.  The system does not attempt to auto-complete the "@ mention" and therefore we cannot leverage this feature which is so critical to our distributed team.

* I have validated this bug exists in IE, Firefox, Chrome
* I have validated this bug exists for other users logging into this same URL with their logins
fields.summary: @ mention feature does not work

fields.description:
We are looking for a way to be able to use the existing JIRA Agile "Work" view to see developer stories that are in progress/resolved/closed, but that aren't part of the current sprint, without being required to pull the stories into the current sprint (which affects our Burndown reports)

Currently (we are on JIRA Agile OnDemand) the JIRA Agile "Work" filter only allows viewing stories that are included in the current sprint.  If a developer wants to view/show other "in progress" (or resolved) stories they are working on, they are forced to pull the story into the Sprint, which can adversely affect the Sprint burndown report (adding the story causes the "remaining values" to spike up for non-closed issues).

It would be nice if we had some type of filter/toggle in Work view to enable displaying these stories on the board (we don't really care about the "to do" items, mainly the "in progress" and "resolved" ones).

Alternatively (if this was easier to implement), perhaps the Work view could be changed to allow the Sprint "selector" to change to a future sprint and/or the backlog so we could view in progress stories in that manner. (Currently it has an arrow that seems to indicate that it would display a selector, but this only shows us the sprint start/end dates and the "Complete sprint" button)

(This may be somewhat related to GHS-9723)

Hopefully I explained this clearly enough, if not please let me know if I can clarify what we're looking for.
fields.summary: As a user, I need the Agile board Work filter to allow viewing of in progress issues not in the current sprint

fields.description:
In our current instalation (GH 6.2.2) we make an extensive use of version hierarchy and I am not sure if after upgrading this functionality is going to disappear.
We have more than 1000 projects, if version hierarchy is going to disappear it is a blocker for us

Best Regards
fields.summary: Version Hierarchy now supported in Classic

fields.description: Sprint with the same name shouldn't allowed to be created especially for sprints in the same board.
fields.summary: Sprint with the same name shouldn't allowed to be created
As a user I would like to know the board type in the Manage Boards screen (Scrum or Kanban)

fields.description:
If different context is defined for the Flagged Custom Field, Jira Agile board action "Flag" doesn't work.

It doesn't work for the projects inside the new context only. For projects on the default context Flagging works fine.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Go to Custom Fields: <instance>/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
# Click on configure for field Flagged
# Add new Context and add it for just one agile project.
# Go to that project's board
# right click on an issue and select 'Add a Flag'

- Expected: Issue is flagged
- Result: Error shown
!flagged.jpeg!

This configuration would be useful to flag issues when created for a group of projects and easily distinguish them on the board.

h4. Workaround: 

Avoid creating additional configuration context for Flagged field and reserve only one configuration context for the field for now.
fields.summary: Context Flagged custom field causes error when Flagging issue on Board
Scrollbar missing in Agile Board filter selection

fields.description:
As a HuffPost product manager, I would like for tickets that roll over to return to the top of the backlog, not to the first open sprint. 

CONTEXT:
Because we have several teams, we usually have several sprints open (but not started). We also often have tickets that roll over to the next sprint. 

Currently when you close a sprint, any unresolved tickets are supposed to return to the top of the backlog. However, there's a bug in JIRA where the ticket is not returned to the _top of the backlog_ but instead is sent to the _first open, unstarted sprint_. The result is that, when closing sprints, we often add tickets to the wrong sprint and have to hunt for the tickets and remove them manually from those sprints. The hope is that the tickets would return to the top of the actual backlog. 

EC: When unresolved tickets roll over, return them to the top of the backlog, not to first open, unstarted sprint.
fields.summary: Tickets that roll over return to open sprints, not top of backlog

fields.description:
This may relate to GHS-3922 although it's not clear.  Is there any future plan to allow multiple avatars to show on a single card?  Either via multiple assignees or by flagging another field as a trigger to display an avatar?  

I'm not looking for a definite delivery date, just an understanding if this is on the roadmap.  This is something my company would love to see for pair programming and shared testing support between our QEs and SWEs
fields.summary: Multiple Avatars on one Card

fields.description: Our organization has monthly releases with many teams integrating into a single release stream. In most cases, we will not do a release for a product until we complete a set of features that are deemed minimally marketable (MMF).  We create the plan to get to MMF in Classic Jira by using a Parent version with multiple sprints grouped under that version.  The Classic Agile Gadget is then used to show a Release Burndown,  We MUST have that visibility into the Release Plan before we migrate to Jira Agile.  We're also able to look at velocity within that gadget, and that would also be a great addition, but is not as critical for our organization.
fields.summary: Need a Release Burndown chart before we can move from the Classic Boards

fields.description:
In order not to loose info in my crude translation I also add the orginal german complain we receviced from our end user:

Im Vorgangsnavigator gibt es das Feld SPRINT, das man aber leider in der Darstellung (Ergebnisansicht) nicht sortieren kann. Liegt hier ein Bug vor?

My Interpretation is: 

In the task navigator exists a field named SPRINT. the result set is not sortable by this field (SPRINT). 
Is this a bug?
fields.summary: Make the "Sprint" field in Issue Navigator sortable
No need GreenHopper with all its stuff (fields, en...

fields.description: When a board is created for a project, a filter was created with Project name which is shared to users of project. I would like to restrict the feature by making "Not shared" as default.
fields.summary: Enable filter sharing as "Not Shared" by default instead of selected project

fields.description: When clicking the "Give Feedback" tab (the little "email icon" at the lower left hand corner of JIRA Agile), a dialog appears to give Atlassian Feedback on JIRA Agile. Unfortunately, there IS no "Send/Close/Cancel" button, nor is there any kind of "X" (in the upper right hand corner) to remove the dialog. This prevents further use of the application, unless you refresh the entire page (via the Browser's refresh button), potentially losing information previously entered into the page, (which is why this is "Critical", and not "Blocker", as the page is not totally useless after this, but "Critical", since valuable information can be lost when trying to fix/workaround this issue).
fields.summary: "Give Feedback" Dialog has no "Send/Close/Cancel" buttons - It is NOT possible to give feedback, NOR get rid of the dialog...

fields.description: When using JIRA Agile and I have the swimlanes set to "Arrange Issue by Assignee", there is a little tab at the lower left hand corner ("Give Feedback") that covers up the last line of the swimlane, preventing the use of the "down/right" arrow (used to expand the information on that Assignee). If I have a lot of information above, I must try to close/open other "down/right" arrows, until I [somehow] can un-obscure that line. This is a major annoyance.
fields.summary: "Give Feedback" tab obscures "down arrows" in swimlanes of JIRA Agile preventing their use

fields.description: Would like a way to generate/see a report which shows issue added after a sprint has already started
fields.summary: Create a report for items that were added after a sprint has started

fields.description:
Currently, the search result in JIRA export into XML view only able to show the Sprint ID itself. 

Example:
{code}
<customfield id="customfield_11163" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint">
<customfieldname>Sprint</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues>
<customfieldvalue>146</customfieldvalue>
</customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
{code}

However, it would be best if it can include the actual *Sprint name* instead in the XML view itself.
fields.summary: XML view to contain sprint name
